name: Adult Coordinated Entry (ACE)
description: ADULT COORDINATED ENTRY (ACE) is the foundation of San Francisco’s Homelessness Response System (HRS), treating homelessness as an emergency to be addressed quickly and effectively. Episcopal Community Services manages this citywide function. ACE is a consistent, community-wide intake process to match people experiencing homelessness to available housing and/or focused community resources that are the best fit for their situation. It includes a clear set of entry points, a standardized method to

howToGetIt: For more information about San Francisco’s Coordinated Entry program, please visit an Access Point . Locations: 123 10th Street (@Mission)-Monday-Friday, 9:00am – 4:30pm 1138 Howard Street-Monday-Friday, 9:00am – 4:30pm Mobile Team (415) 487-3300 x7000 or SFACES@ECS-SF.org
keywords: i am experiencing homelessness and i need immediate help finding shelter.
i am experiencing homelessness (on the street, couchsurfing, or other) and i need long-term housing assistance.
